DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Thyroid Stimulating Hormone Performed Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH), a hormone produced by the pituitary gland that stimulates the release of thyroid hormone from thyroglobulin.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Thyroid Stimulating Hormone Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH), a hormone produced by the pituitary gland that stimulates the release of thyroid hormone from thyroglobulin.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A hormone produced by the pituitary gland. TSH stimulates the release of thyroid hormone from thyroglobulin. It also stimulates the growth of thyroid follicular cells. An abnormal TSH level may mean that the thyroid hormonal regulation system is out of control, usually as a result of a benign condition (hyperthyroidism or hypothyroidism).:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A peptide hormone secreted by the anterior pituitary. It promotes the growth of the thyroid gland and stimulates the synthesis of thyroid hormones and the release of thyroxine by the thyroid gland.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have TSH within institutional/laboratory normal limits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Thyroid function TSH within normal limits

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) within institutional normal limits. Patients may be on replacement doses of thyroid medication

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) within institutional normal limits. If TSH is greater or less than Institutional limits patients may participate if their T4 is WNL. Patients may be on a stable dose of replacement doses of thyroid medication. Dose adjustments are allowed if needed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) within institutional normal limits. Patients may be on a stable dose of replacement thyroid medication. Dose adjustments are allowed if needed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was serum TSH and AM (morning) cortisol obtained within 14 days prior to randomization to obtain a baseline value?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have TSH within institutional/laboratory normal limits?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was serum TSH and AM (preferably in morning) cortisol obtained within 14 days prior to study entry to obtain a baseline value?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have TSH within normal limits?
